params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the discount rule to delete.

docs.summary: Retrieve all discounts that can be applied to the given line items.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the discount rule to retrieve.

docs.summary:
Query discount rules using [WQL (Wix Query Language)](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).
Total entries (`pagingMetadata.total`) will be returned only for the first page.

description:
Each time the discount rule is updated, `revision` increments by 1.
The existing `revision` must be included when updating the discount rule.
This ensures you're working with the latest discount rule information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: end
members.doc: Discount rule active end time.

members.name: start
members.doc: Discount rule active start time.

members.name: triggers
members.doc: Array of triggers. Currently chaining up to 2 triggers is supported.

members.name: appliedDiscountRule
members.doc: Applied discount rule.

members.name: discountType
members.doc: Discount type.

members.name: lineItemIds
members.doc: IDs of line items the discount applies to.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Discount rule ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Total discount amount from all line items the discount applied to.

members.name: discountRuleType
members.doc: Discount rule type.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: catalogAppId
members.doc: Catalog App ID. For example, the Wix Stores `appId`, or the 3rd-party `appId`.

members.name: catalogItemIds
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the catalog app. For example, the Wix Stores `appId`, or the 3rd-party `appId`.

members.name: catalogItemId
members.doc: ID of the item within its Wix or 3rd-party catalog. For example, `productId` for Wix Stores or `eventId` for Wix Events.

members.name: options
members.doc: Additional info in key:value form. For example, `{"options":{"Size": "M", "Color": "Red"}}` or `{"variantId": "<VARIANT_ID>"}`.

description: Used for grouping line items and is sent on add to cart

members.doc: Discount rule info.

members.doc: Discount rule.

members.doc: Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Trigger ID.

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID of the trigger creator.

members.name: params
members.doc:
Optional - additional data in key:value form.
+ This data will be passed to the Custom Triggers Service SPI.
+ For example, for a weather trigger that would be eligible if temperature is above 30 degrees, params would be: `{ "minTemp": 30 }`.

members.name: appId
members.doc: Custom filter app ID.

members.name: params
members.doc:
Custom-filter related data in key:value form.
For example, an array of collectionIDs: `{ ["collectionId": "12345"], ["collectionId": "67890"] }`.

members.doc: Amount to be discounted from original price.

members.doc: Fixed price. Line item will be fixed to this price.

members.doc: Whether the discount rule is active.

members.name: activeTimeInfo
members.doc: Time frame when the discount rule is active.

members.name: discounts
members.doc:
Description of a set of discounts that can be performed, if the trigger/s is met.
Currently only a single discount is supported.

members.name: name
members.doc: Discount rule name.

members.name: offer
members.doc: calculated string which describe the discount rule   //WHAT CAN BE THE MAXIMAL VAL?

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the discount rule is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when updating a discount rule.

members.name: status
members.doc: Discount rule status.

members.name: trigger
members.doc:
Discount rule trigger. Description of a set of conditions that must be fulfilled to perform pre-defined discounts (see `discounts` field).
Not providing a trigger means the discount rule will always be applied (if possible).

members.name: usageCount
members.doc: Number of times the discount rule was used.

members.name: original
members.doc: Original discount rule name (in site's default language).

members.name: translated
members.doc: Translated discount rule name according to buyer language. Defaults to `original` when not provided.

members.doc: Chain multiple triggers with AND operator.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dipatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dipatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: Line items for which to check for discount rules.

Optional - Catalog and item reference info. See [Catalog SPI](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rest/ecommerce/catalog-spi/introduction) for more details.
Empty in the case of a custom line item.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: The offset which was requested. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: total
members.doc: The total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging was used.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter object.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options. For example, `[{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]`.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging

members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Scope ID.

members.name: catalogItemFilter
members.doc: Catalog item filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: customFilter
members.doc: Custom filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: type
members.doc: Scope type.

description:
This object represents a scope of catalog items. Examples:
1. All catalog items of a specific app - type = CATALOG_ITEM, CatalogItemFilter with `catalog_app_id`
2. Specific catalog item - type = CATALOG_ITEM, CatalogItemFilter with `catalog_app_id` + `catalog_item_ids`
3. External catalog filter - type = CUSTOM_FILTER, CustomFilter with 'app_id' + 'params'
4. All items - type = ALL_ITEMS, without ScopeItems

members.name: catalogItemFilter
members.doc: Catalog item filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: customFilter
members.doc: Custom filter. Must be passed with `type."CATALOG_ITEM"`.

members.name: order

members.name: scopes
members.doc: All associated scopes for `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.

members.name: from
members.doc: Price range - from (inclusive).

members.name: scopes
members.doc:
All associated scopes for `SPECIFIC_ITEMS` target type.
The trigger will be eligible if the line item is contained in one of the scopes.

members.name: to
members.doc: Price range - to (inclusive).
